column1: Punta Cardón is a town and parish in the Carirubana autonomous municipality of Falcón state
The town was once a poor fishing community on the Gulf of Coro on the northwest coast of Venezuela.
Since the mid-1940s the community has become surrounded by the Paraguana- oil-refining complex
column2: which today is run by PDVSA

column1: The Spanish architect José Lino Vaamonde built the Club Manaure in Punta Cardón (1953) for Shell Venezuela.
